parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The identifier of this element used to reference it in other components

parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: consumerKey
parameter.description: The OAuth consumerKey as registered with the service provider

parameter.name: consumerSecret
parameter.description: The OAuth consumerSecret as registered with the service provider

parameter.name: authorizationUrl
parameter.description: The service provider's authorization endpoint URL

parameter.name: accessTokenUrl
parameter.description: The service provider's accessToken endpoint URL

parameter.name: scopes
parameter.description: The OAuth scopes to be requested during the dance. If not provided, it will default to those in the annotation

parameter.name: resourceOwnerId
parameter.description: The resourceOwnerId which each component should use if it doesn't reference otherwise.

parameter.name: before
parameter.description: The name of a flow to be executed right before starting the OAuth dance

parameter.name: after
parameter.description: The name of a flow to be executed right after an accessToken has been received

parameter.name: listenerConfig
parameter.description: A reference to a <http:listener-config /> to be used in order to create the listener that will catch the access token callback endpoint.

parameter.name: callbackPath
parameter.description: The path of the access token callback endpoint

parameter.name: authorizePath
parameter.description: The path of the local http endpoint which triggers the OAuth dance

parameter.name: externalCallbackUrl
parameter.description: If the callback endpoint is behind a proxy or should be accessed through a non direct URL, use this parameter to tell the OAuth provider the URL it should use to access the callback

parameter.name: objectStore
parameter.description: A reference to the object store that should be used to store each resource owner id's data. If not specified, runtime will automatically provision the default one.

operation.name: getAdminconversationssearch
operation.description: Search for public or private channels in an Enterprise organization. This operation makes an HTTP GET request to the `/admin.conversations.search` endpoint.

parameter.name: teamIds
parameter.description: Comma-separated string of team IDs that defines the workspaces to search through.

parameter.name: sortDir
parameter.description: Sort direction. Possible values are `asc` for ascending order, like 1, 2, 3 or a, b, c, and `desc` for descending order, like 3, 2, 1 or c, b, a.

parameter.name: searchChannelTypes
parameter.description: Type of channel to include or exclude in the search. For example, `private` searches private channels, while `private_exclude` excludes them. For a full list of types, check the [Types section](#types).

parameter.name: query
parameter.description: Name of the the channel to query by.

parameter.name: cursor
parameter.description: Set `cursor` to `next_cursor` returned by the previous call to list items in the next page.

parameter.name: sort
parameter.description: Possible values are: `relevant` (search ranking based on what is determined to be closest), `name` (alphabetical), `member_count` (number of users in the channel), and `created` (date channel was created). You can optionally pair this with the `sort_dir` argument to change how it is sorted.

parameter.name: limit
parameter.description: Maximum number of items to return. Must be between 1 and 20, both inclusive. Default is `10`.

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

operation.name: getWorkflowsupdateStep
operation.description: Update the configuration for a workflow extension step. This operation makes an HTTP GET request to the /workflows.updateStep endpoint.

parameter.name: stepName
parameter.description: Optional field used to override the step name that is shown in the Workflow Builder.

parameter.name: outputs
parameter.description: JSON array of output objects used during step execution. This is the data your app agrees to provide when your workflow step is executed.

parameter.name: workflowStepEditId
parameter.description: Context identifier provided with `view_submission` payloads used to call back to `workflows.updateStep`.

parameter.name: inputs
parameter.description: JSON key-value map of inputs required from a user during configuration. This is the data your app expects to receive when the workflow step starts. **NOTE**: The embedded variable format is set and replaced by the workflow system. You cannot create custom variables that will be replaced at runtime. [Read more about variables in workflow steps here](/workflows/steps#variables).

parameter.name: stepImageUrl
parameter.description: Optional field used to override the app image that is shown in the Workflow Builder.
